mp3s run @ -10
why do you think you can only renice root-started programs?
you can run whatever program you like "@ -10", if i interpret that correctly, without running it as root
: because running sudo is annoying, default programs should be 0, FAH -3 mp3s -10 fireofox -1
: you need root to make it past -1
no, you don't. you do need to *be* root for a moment, in order to renice the process, but you most definitely don't *need* (and *should not*) *run* the process as root
it's your choice, of course, but be aware that it's a choice disapproved of by almost everyone with some attention to security
: so running mp3blaster as root to access all mp3s with locate -i mp3s is comprimising me in what way?
: i know
yes, it is. who's telling you mp3blaster doesn't have any bad bugs?
and, why should *not* running it as root prevent access to "all your mp3s"?
: because mp3s are on two local disks, 4 remote disks, with various users
if your user doesn't have read access on those, then your permissions are broken, fix them
you run rootchecks often, and you run that kind of programs as root? at least be consistent...
